Reviews.Title: “This hotel gets better year by year”
Reviews.Author: Nigel73Oslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in March 2012. We had a 1 bedroom deluxe apartment which was booked direct with the hotel. Even though it says 1 bedroom, they had placed an extra double bed in the living room, so you can easily sleep 5 (2 doubles + 1 single bed) We had a sea view - but no balcony (we were happy for that with young kids,,, and a long drop) Positives: 1) Plenty Space 2) Modern apartments serviced daily 3) Well equipped kitchen for simple family meals (+ iron + safe + washer/dryer....etc...) 4) Attentive & friendly staff (a big difference from 2010 and 2011 stays) 5) Fast and simple check-in and check-out Negatives. (nothing really, but....) 1) The main pool is too cold. Fine for serious 'sports' swimming - but too chilly for the kids 2) We suffered noise on this stay: a) Elevators binging all night next to our room b) Huge pool party & disco just outside our room until 10pm : without warning from hotel c) Drilling at 10:30 and 11:30 at night (Turned out to be in the offices 7 floors below us!) I would certainly stay here again - and I would certainly recommend staying there for business or leisure. Always Taxis available on the door step night ans day - and all taxis know the hotel when coming home. Metro station on the door step (but this must be the only station on the whole network with 50 (fifty) steps to climb... beware if you have a pram or little kids! Our 2 and 5 year old were fine though. (Station name is Internet City) Dubai is so spread out - there isn't a 'central' location, unless you want a beach hotel. 30AED taxi to the Jumeirah Beach Park 20AED taxi to Aquaventure 15AED taxi to the Mall of the Emirates (although this is only 2 stops away on the Metro)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ayidha
Reviews.Content: This is the ideal affordable hotel in a central location. We stayed here for three nights. Unfortunately our flight arrived at 7 am and our room was not available until 2 pm. However, we offered the use of the gym changing rooms to have a shower and freshen up. So after an awesome Meditteranean breakfast we were off on a shopping spree. Being centrally located on Sheikh Zayed Road, and only a 5 minutes walk to the metro station, travelling about was a breeze. And if you needed to get somewhere in a hurry, simply step out and hail a cab in less than 3 minutes. There are plenty of cabs circling the area. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment that was clean and tastefully furnished. At times the place seemed too big, but it was really comfortable. The kichenette comes in handy if you are a long stay guest, but since we were there only for a few nights and was out most of the time, we did not use the facilities much. Overall, the staff were quite pleasant and helpful. Definitely will be back with friends for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect middle plus hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martinenene
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days in late january, and had a wonderful time. The staff was very very nice and helpful. The atmosphere of the hotel was great. The room was clean and comfy, a nice poolside at 6th floor (which between 14:00 and 15:00 is in the shadow of another tall building near by) location was ok+, breakfast, lunch etc was ok. A perfect middle plus hotel, great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ambia547
Reviews.Content: We was given a very warm welcome as soon as we arrived outside the hotel. As soon as we got out the taxi we was greeted by the bell boy who took our luggage. Further into the hotel we was greeted by the hotel managers, they was very polite and helpful. We had no problems booking, this was quick and convenient. We was shown to our room which was a one bedroom apartment. This hotel is in a great location. Less than 5minutes walk from the hotel to the nearest metro station (Internet city). You've got the Dubai Marina on one side of the line and the Emirates mall on the other, where there is a supermarket. You can catch a bus from outside the hotel to the beach. The hotel is just outside the main road of Sheikh Al Zayed Road. It took us 30 minutes from the airport to the hotel. This hotel has three swimming pools, two large and one small paddle pool. The thing we loved most about the hotel was the outside Jacuzzi by the pools. The hotel also has separate Sauna and Steam rooms within the Mens and Ladies changing rooms which was quite convenient for privacy. The hotel is neutrally decorated but with expensive taste. Another superb thing about the hotel is it comes with a Kitchen so you can make your own snacks and drinks. Would recommend this hotel. But remember to book a seaview room if you would like one because they have different booking for different sides. we went in January and the weather there was sunny everyday but we had wind that made the day cool, never the less this enabled us to get around more. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: Miles S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night having been sold the room in a 'lucky dip' type arrangement touting the hotel as 5 star. My room was a suite on the 17th floor -- huge and overlooking The Palm with the Burj Al Arab in sight. The views were nothing short of spectacular thanks to the large windows covering most of the walls. The suite was very spacious with a kitchen and living room separated from the bedroom and bathroom. Having just come from a hotel where the service was incredible, it may be unfair to say that I did not get an as warm welcome at this hotel as I would have expected, but I felt the whole place was a little bit sterile and less homely than I would've liked, but others may see it differently. I didn't experience any of the dining in the hotel so cannot comment on that. The outdoor pool area was clean and attractive, with the benefit of a hot tub and an infinity edge to the pool, with views to the The Palm and ocean. Location-wise, it's conveniently right next to the metro station (a 30 second walk) out of the front entrance. Speaking of which, that entrance is right on the busy main road but seems to be somewhat still unfinished i.e. piles of sand. Overall, I wouldn't jump at the chance to stay here again. It's good, but there are so many great hotels to choose from in Dubai that make your stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Jorgepab
Reviews.Content: Well place, between the palm/marina and the centre, just in the sheik zayed road (you cannot feel the noise) this hotel is within standards (arabian always that are quite good) and it does offer a really pleasure stay. The rooms where huge, with kitchen included. The restaurant was average but full of food, and really nice staff... The building contains some offices so it's a bit a 'no charming' feeling.... Anyway, this could be great even for a family as the bedrooms where quite big and clean. The swimming pool was ok with great views of the burj al arab, and it had a jacuzzi you could use as much as you want. The worst is that any service or facility (such as wi-fi) is extra charged...

Reviews.Title: “just perfect.... or not”
Reviews.Author: mmeStockholm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 7 nights. Had booked a studio, but was upgraded to a bigger apartment by a very nice front desk staff. Had a very nice and spacious apartment on the 14th floor, overlooking the Palm and Burj al Arab. Very nice staff at the hotel. The problem at Midwest Tower was that either the service was perfect or non-existing. Either the breakfast (ordered via roomservice) was divine... including really everything one could imagine or terreible with ice cold baked beans, no orange juice or bread as they had missed to put it on the breakfast tray. Same regarding the cleaning usually the personel did a perfect job....or they forgot to fix our room and we had to call them like 3 times at 8pm to get the room in order. Nice pool area and gym. Some restaurants and coffee shops around the hotel, but usually we took a taxi to Mall of Emirates that is very near and other places, as the Internet City where the hotel is located is quiet. Wifi is expensive, but on the 2nd floor business center it is foc. Would recommend this place as good value for many being in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Scary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sociss-de-Monbe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 1 night over the week-end. The hotel is in the middle of a business area, so nothing happens over the week-end. There was hardly anyone staying over that week-end, as well as hardly any staff around. It felt very much like in the movie Shining.... a very scary atmosphere. Our room was facing the city with the 2x 5-lane roads. Room was simple, clean and ok comfy. We are going back to Dubai in February but will surely try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Mid West Tower Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Christine T
Reviews.Content: Booked late through Expedia secret hotel. Knew it was in Jumeirah beach area and was a 5 star rating. Arrived early but could not check in til 2pm. You have to enter the hotel from the back as the footpath at the front has not been completed yet. Receptionist was not particularly cheerful and seemed quite short at times. When we returned at 2pm, booking in was relatively painless and did not take too long. All of the other hotel staff were cheerful and extremely helpful. We had booked a double room but received a one-bedroom apartment on floor 10. It was spacious, tidy and clean and had everything we required. It was cleaned thoroughly every day and clean towels provided. The furnishings were very modern (fully fitted kitchen. leather sofa in lounge, etc.) There was a flat screen TV in both the lounge and the bedroom which had numerous channels to watch, none of which were UK channels, although there were re-runs of UK soaps on one of the American channels. The hotel does not have a bar and is not licensed! If you like a drink in the evening make sure you stock up on arrival at Dubai airport. Some hotels and a few bars and restaurants are licensed, but with most alcoholic drinks starting at around £8, it is worth having some in your room. There is an outdoor pool on floor 6 along with a well equipped gym. Towels are provided and there are plenty of sun beds around the pool. There is a small supermarket around the corner (about 5 min walk) which is handy to stock up on soft drinks and snacks. There is ample space in the apartment fridge. The hotel is right next to the Dubai Internet City metro station. We used the metro regularly to get around and found it to be extremely good value. A one day travel pass was 16 dirham (around £3 at current exchange rates) and could be used as often as needed during the day. The metro was very impressive. It runs on time and is very clean and tidy. All of the announcements are in English and Arabic making it very easy to navigate around the many tourist attractions. The Burj Khalifa and Dubai Mall are approx 25mins (plus a 10 min walk) and the Mall of the Emirates is approx 15 min and is directly linked to the metro via a short air conditioned walk. The Dubai Marina is also about 15 min on the metro. Walking around Dubai is difficult because of all the roadworks taking place which mean that the footpath disappears. That said, we did manage to walk to the nearest public beach which took around 15 minutes. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will certainly visit Dubai again. The hotel was in a good location for many of the attractions, however I would not agree that this hotel is a 5 star as there is no bar. In my opinion it is at best a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is at good location but its problem the bad service”
Reviews.Author: Dee_uae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as couple with infant,we booked the one bed room apartment, the room is clean but its need more attention specially the bed sheets and the floor. Also they over booked the hotel and when we arrived at the hotel at night tired they said we will move you to another hotel which is on the other side of dubai! Also they charge you for extra blankets Over all there are many hotel in dubai better than this one with the same rate. As frequent traveler to dubai I didn't stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Georgiana A
Reviews.Content: Excellent in everything!!!! Very good location, friendly and helpful staff, clean, large apartments, pool etc. Very close to metro station, Palm Jumeirah ( 10 minutes drive) burj khalifa (15 minutes by car), beaches (10 minutes by car). They also have a tour desk in the lobby area and they offer you very good rates for any tours. We took the safari tour, which has to be on the "to do" list for every tourist that visits dubai.We paid 30 Euro/person.Then we had Dubai City Tour which I advise, Wild Wadi tickets with 30 % discount etc. I really recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “certainly not the best - I would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: lukeskywalker_fi
Reviews.Content: staying here as I write this in a hotel apartment. The reception is very very poor - never enough staff and everthing takes a very long time. The 1 bed appartment is large - but the furnishings are very poor, old and in need of much updating. Allthough this is sold as an appartment - there are no kitchen knives, the pans given are in very poor state of repair and basically all you have a plates, glasses and knives and forks - nothing to really be self catering or even attempt to cook anything. Breakfast in a morning is extreamly poor - with little quality choice (compared to other hotels I have stayed in in Dubai) and especially the fruit juice is dreadfull. I had mold all over my ceiling last week (and although painted its coming back already). The porter "Ram" is very friendly and the guy cleaning the room trys his best with what he has.. but simple things like cleaning the balcony are forgotten and thus if you walk outside your feet are black... There are only 3 lifts for 20 odd floors (with no stairs) and one has been totally out of service for 2 weeks.... says it all really. The gym is OK and so is the pool - although again the pools needs maintenance more sunbeds, and a very good clean around the patio area. You are 50 mts from the metro line - thus its convienient. If you have a choice avoid this place. I am only staying as I am moving to Dubai and this is temporary accomodation before I move to my own apartment and this hotel its next to my office.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Saudi_australia
Reviews.Content: The entrance of the hotel from the back is not appropriate. I hope you fix this problem before the next time of me coming as a guest to your beautiful memories in your hotel. Other than that, everything is fine and I am looking forward to come again soon as a guest to your beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I’ll be definitely back.”
Reviews.Author: khedo
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant time at Grand Midwest Tower. The place is neat. Staff are helpful. Requests are promptly addressed. Gym is very useful. Value for price is great.

Reviews.Title: “very large rooms”
Reviews.Author: hakan2z
Reviews.Content: rooms are very large, service is regular, internet is extreemly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: penticost
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand midwest for 3 nights, we didn't arrive until very late and found it quite strange that we arrived through the back entrance. The road at the front of the hotel has not been finished so they use the back. Staff were very friendly and helpful and we were checked in very quickly. We had a one bedroom suite that sleeps four, the rooms were beautifully furnished and plently of space. We had a sea facing suite, which is much nicer than city facing, however if you ask for a corner facing sea view you will also get a balcony. We only had two towels in the bathroom and no face towels or hand towels. However the next day I did ask the cleaner for more and was only too willing to give us some. The metro is very close and so easy to use, and the taxi's are always available outside the hotel and very cheap to use. A grate base to see the best of Dubai has to offer. Make sure you ask where the supermarket is, we couldn't find it and only found it on the last day. The swimming pool is small but very relaxing and great views, however for two of our days it was closed for cleaning, so we needed to go to the beach. All in all I would recommed this hotel to stay and would not hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ravitha
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was an excellent choice. It was clean, had large rooms with all amenities that were required. The rooms were well suited to us and we were extremely satisfied with the accommodation. The staff were extremely helpful and assisted us with all our requests speedily and efficiently, no matter what the hour. The Hotel is well situated and near the Metro which is a huge advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: ckdrinkwater
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a number of friends for a wedding this December. While the inside of the hotel is relatively nice and well maintained, the area immediately around the hotel is only half completed, so much so that you need to access the hotel from the rear entrance as opposed to from the front. Also it is next to a major motorway, so there is a constant level of noise outside. Overall as we were going as a group of friends, not looking to spend much time in the hotel, it served it's purposes sufficiently, but I would certainly not recommend staying there for people looking for a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed six weeks and won't do it again”
Reviews.Author: dubbs2k2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Midwest for six weeks for a business stay. For that reason I feel I have a pretty good grasp of what the experience is really like. Below are the good and bad things about the hotel from my experience. Location is good and access to the freeway is good. The hotel pool is nice and the gym is also nice but pretty small. Parking in the second floor basement was nice. It was annoying not to get a badge to park underground. Every time I pulled in I had to wait sometimes up to 5 min until someone from the hotel realized it was me who was honking trying to get their attention to come and badge me in. The hotel cleaning service was very poor. Because I transacted a lot of business with the states, I was often up very late. Every time I slept in past 9am I was awoken by the cleaning service either talking too loud in the hall or loudly cleaning an adjacent room. The cleaning service also never really cleaned. They vacuumed, replaced the towels, and made the bed but never cleaned. I ended up getting bathroom cleaner and cleaning the entire bathroom and kitchen myself. If you don't believe me that they never really cleaned. Ask my wife who visited who is 3 months pregnant if the toilet ever got cleaned and she'll confirm it never did :) If your room like mine was on the side of the freeway, don't think you'll ever be able to open the window without getting a lot of noise. Every employee thinks they can speak English but none of them can so don't think anything you say will be understood and answered correctly. Because no employee really understands you, don't expects to get great service. I asked at least 30x and 10 different people to have the clock on my TV changed to the correct time. In six weeks I never had somebody come and fix it. I had a studio apartment with a kitchen. In the kitchen one of the electrical burners did not work. Again, I asked at least 30x and 10 different people to please come and fix the burner. It was never fixed. The internet is expensive and doesn't work very well. The internet is 300 dirhams for a week and it is wireless. Two times the internet went out for 5 plus hours. I sat in the lobby with multiple other guests trying to get the hotel to do something but because they didn't understand English and the IT guy leaves at 5pm we were stuck with no internet. I wrote the hotel and never received a proper apology. The two holidays I stayed during revealed that the hotel significantly allowed the rooms to be overbooked which forced a lot of complaints. Overall after six weeks I will never stay at the Grand Midwest again. I think they are trying to establish themselves as a legitimate hotel but have a long way to go. I switched to the Nuran Hotel Apts in the Marina a week ago and if you look at the costs its not much more here and the quality of experience is a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rani79
Reviews.Content: Good service and very clean rooms 1906+1907, staff was friendly, superr

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: RonanW1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 12 nights here and got great value for money. Central location is handy for siteseeing and also within close proximity to many beaches. Pool and gym are usually quiet and relaxing. Staff are very helpful when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but very poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Vickks
Reviews.Content: I have made booking from expedia, hotel people assigned me room facing Zayed road, where I was expecting to get the room facing palm jumeira. I requested reception guy but he did not gave any possitive reply. Enough car parking in the basement. I faced difficulties to reach to hotel. B/F is ok. Rooms are clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good”
Reviews.Author: Thamer_alfaisal
Reviews.Content: The only thing made choose this hotel is the location and the value for the location. The food was bad, service was not bad, pool was nice but small, NO MAIN ENTRANCE for this hotel. I found 450 dr chon my bill for using the phone, and I never been touch it during the stay After all it's good if you have business in media city or in Internet city, it's in the middle of the major companies.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Sharjah
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit in the Grand Midwest (first time December 2009 and first two weeks of May 2010) We were pleasantly surprised that the reception recognized us as we checked in. Check in time was less than 5 minutes and our request to stay on the top floor with view to the Palm Jumeirah was granted with no questions ask. Room again spacious and well groomed. The room layout was different compared to last visit. After all it was a different room. Unfortunately we had to ask for a third pair of slippers and extra bath towels since my family exist of three people. In general they improved their way of working (quickly and efficiently). The room was clean at arrival and always properly cleaned by a friendly staff. The Bellboy was very polite and helpful. We used the garage beneath the apartment. (Free access) Unfortunately the main entrance is still under construction (Although the metro station is finished and in use) and not accessible by car. Bathroom and kitchen well equipped however no washing-up brush or kitchen towels available. 2 LCD tv’s, washing/dryer, safe, balcony, WIFI (pay) You need a car since the hotel is located next to Sheikh Zayed Road. Within 10 driving minutes you’re at the Emirates Mall and Ibn batuta Mall in the other direction. 15km away from the municipality beach and 15 minutes away from the Marina. Swimming pool and pool area is proper and bath towel provided. Gym is great and well equipped. We had absolute no negative experience at all. We visited Dubai many times and know where to go. If this is your first visit to Dubai and you’re only familiar with an organized and All incl. Spain / Greece holiday this might be disappointed since you need to be self supporting.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigel73Oslo
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Grand Midwest Tower from the 10th to 16th Feb 2010. This was a pre-paid rate from Expedia. Our room was on the 9th floor, with a sea view – the city view would not be too interesting I guess! We had read previous reviews about the lack of baby cots, so made sure that we mentioned this request in the Expedia booking – however, we shouldn’t have bothered as the hotel paid no attention to the request, and as predicted there were only 6 cots for the whole hotel. Out of the 6 nights, our 6 month old slept on blankets on the floor for all but 1 of the nights. Numerous requests were made to various levels of staff, but this appeared to be a minor issue for them. The windows were absolutely filthy – we managed to clean a patch on the windows by leaning through a gap in the opening, so in the end the view was fine. I can’t believe how dirty the windows were, they made a good sunny day look like an overcast dull day. The windows were double glazed, so the soundproofing was great. There was never a problem catching a taxi from outside the hotel – and we never had a driver who hadn’t heard of the hotel and/or area. Some reviews stated otherwise. The rooms were clean, spacious and modern – although I am quite sure our apartment was one of the largest one bedroom apartments. 1 x 32” Samsung LCD in the lounge and 1 x 26” Samsung LCD in the bedroom, although a few more European channels were needed. We had 1 bathroom inc. WC, and a guest WC near the kitchen. The kitchen was fine, and included the essentials (microwave, toaster, kettle, pans, plates, glasses, etc…) There was also a decent fridge/freezer and a very handy washer/dryer. There were no tea towels, cloths or washing power provided. There was a simple iron and ironing board – and a hair dryer. There was no DVD player, although this is mentioned on every website as included in the room. The bedroom included plenty storage space, and even a small safe (although I think you had to pay to use it). The cleaning staff did a good job every day, they were very discrete and friendly. The apartment was missing a dining table in our opinion – there was a breakfast bar, but this is hardly suitable for children. We had a balcony, but this was not very child friendly, with easy options for climbing up and over the rails (and as there was no lock on the balcony door, it was a bit of a hazard for our 3 year old). There are two decent shops very close by, a 24hr restaurant on the premises, and a COSTA coffee in the next building. The METRO stop is right outside, but was not open in February 2010. The Gym, Sauna and Steam room were ok – but the pool and ‘Jacuzzi’ were far too cold (and therefore empty!). Don’t expect hotel ‘like’ service – think of it like a short term flat rental from a dodgy landlord. Tourist info was limited and/or wrong. This hotel(?) is a very affordable choice, but avoid it if you have young kids – or bring your own cot! The staff were well aware there were no cots, but would try to convince us every day that they would ‘find a solution’ – which never came. Perfect for couples or those travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!”
Reviews.Author: vader4
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for six days. The room was beyond what we expected. Five star +. We had a washmachine! The hotelstab was really nice and professional. And did their best to satisfied our needs! The gym and sauna was perfect, also the pool. The hotel was easy to find for the taxidrivers and it layed on the right place of town. Dubai Media City/internet city. Near the Emirats Mall, metro and near the Jumeria Beach and so on. The hotelguestes where mixed- families, buissnessmen, couples, singels. GOOD GOOD GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: alan016
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for one night; I booked at short notice at a discount rate. I found the room excellent in terms of both value and amenities. They do an excellent lunch-time buffet; very good value. There is a nice gym and swimming area although I did not use them. On the following morning, having checked out and sitting in reception waiting for someone to collect me, they searched the whole hotel to pass on a message that the person collecting me would be 10 minutes late!

Reviews.Title: “not fit for purpose especially for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: curlysheep
Reviews.Content: i accompanied my husband on a three day business trip in Jan. we had previously stayed at the hotel in december and found it functional but noisy. this time we had requested a quiet room. we arrived at 2am after a long flight from London. the hotel had overbooked. in other words, they'd cancelled our reservation and offered us a 2 bed apartment which we would have to share with my husband's colleague. given the time no one fancied driving round Dubai looking for alternative accommodation. no one got any sleep. the bedrooms were on the main road and there's no double glazing. smoke alarms are positioned in the ceiling and wink all night. rooms are very spacious but done up cheaply. sinks take ages to drain. the hotel staff are charming and will do all they can to help. however the next day the management could only promise that they would separate us at 5pm. there was no promise of the new accommodation being any quieter. breakfast is uninspiring and nothing looks particularly fresh. filter coffee is only available on request and bears a supplement. my husband and I had had enough. we checked out and found more suitable accommodation 5 minutes away. this hotel is fine if you[re a backpacker, deaf, or have a family who don't mind noise. the rates are competitive, the rooms very very spacious, there's a nice gym and a pool (again on a very busy road). for people who are on business and need their sleep after a long journey it's just not up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family”
Reviews.Author: VirvaK
Reviews.Content: An apartment solution is great when travelling with kids of any age. There's a kitchen to cook breakfast and supper and a washing machine to wash those messy clothes. Of course - there's not any dish washing brush etc. but we managed just fine. The location is the weakest link, since it seemed quite hard to get a taxi at evening.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Midwest Tower Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Zayad Road, Dubai 125616, United Arab Emirates
